fields_of_interest: Consumers, Education and training, Trans-European Networks, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: All regulatory initiatives for financial services industry with regards to consumers and advisors.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Finanzplaner Forum (FPF) is a network of about 5.000 qualified and certified financial advisors and planners in German speaking countries Austria, Germany and Switzerland. It is based in Germany. 
 
FPF supports ethical and competent financial advice and planning as a way to help consumers meet their financial life goals. In doing this, FPF cooperates with certifying bodies throughout Europe, such as FPSB Financial Planning Standards Board and EFPA European Financial Planner Association aisbl. FPF is part of standard setting committees, such as “Basic Financial Analysis for Private Households” at DIN Deutsches Institut für Normung in Berlin, Germany, and through its CEO chairs the Technical Committee ISO22222 Requirements for Financial Planners at the International Standards Organisation.
relevant_communication: Conferences in Austria and Germany with representatives from EU policy makers (MEP) and oversight authorities (BaFin, FMA, ESMA).
